comment: Very special taste. Stands alone.  Slight mint and cinnamon. Extra bite at the end.

Way to young. Could not get paste the aroma of it.   Could taste metal in every sip.  Couldn't  even make a decent Manhattan with it.  Everyone I made a drink with it never finished it. Cool bottle. But that's about all I can say it had going for it.  Try it in a bar before buying a bottle.
Good for a conversation piece not for overall taste
Spicy flavors, goes well in a Manhattan.
Like most ryes I've tried, it's good but kind of odd to me.
Pretty good. A bit pricey IMO.
Was excited to try these and thought they were awful.
A spicy and smooth melody that makes this the perfect sipping whiskey. A gift from Megan
We're still getting to know each other. This relationship could go either way, but I'm happy to let it run for now.
A little too harsh. Good flavor, but need ice to take edge off.
Rye is not my thing, and certainly not this one. Hot!
Not very complex for this range of price. Mellow and a bit spicy on THE final

Anafirst I really did not like this. I was so mad that I spent money on such a crappy whiskey. As time went on I really began to enjoy it in an Old Fashioned.  I still didn't like it neat or on the rocks but in an Old Fashioned it gave it a very unique tasty flavor
Strange. Floral and herby to the point that I had a sudden craving for the Amaro Dell'Erborista afterwards. Definitely not a starter rye, and not what I look for in a whiskey.
Love the spiciness of this rye. Fantastic as an old fashoned or mabhattan.

Quality, but to me lacking distinction.  Nose of carmel honey, smooth with a very nice follow up bite,  hint of raw alcohol burning off with mellowing tingle.    Not sweet, but smooth with sweet cutting the alcohol.

Very pleasant and quite different rye. With the 100% Rye mash this really stands out when nosing, tasting, and on the finish. Imagine fresh rye bread, cinnamon, pepper, raisin/prune sweetness, clove, wood. Also get some tobacco notes as well...perique like notes. Incredibly long, thick legs in the glass. You get the woody, tobacco notes first then a sweet, delicious smooth and soothing burn in the finish...Albieit it's a bit short. Happy with my purchase and even better that they now bottle this juice in the 750ml for a couple of bucks more than the 375ml.
Equal parts sweet and dry vermouth, 1.5 oz Manhattan, stirred
Was OK. My first full bottle.
Citrus on the nose, minty and sweet

[LOOK] Newcastle Brown [NOSE] Rotting flowers, heather, stale biscuit, sifted flour, peach skin, steamed edamame [PALATE] Maple syrup, oatmeal, chutney, dried apricot, malty [FINISH] Medium length, stewed peaches, golden pie crust, sugary [MOUTHFEEL] Nice, pleasant, soft, sweet
Very interesting taste. Very spicey from the rye but a lot more going on. Hot, but maybe some maple?
Jim guy spot this for a dinner party in brought us over the house we all thought it was just me OK

Strong notes of leather. Oily finish. 
It's ok at best
Batch #4. Molasses and burnt caramel, spices and faint hints of smoke. Fruity, but pretty rough - not easy to drink

Extremely spicy. Knowing that before the first sip, it still caught me off guard. The nose was sweet molasses and light caramel. Definitely smells better than it tastes. Spice was so heavy, everything else was blocked out for me.
The spices didn't come out as I had hope but it's there coupled with the maple savoury sweetness.
Tastes like Maker’s. Long afterburn but manageable. Had at Chris’ brothers 1/12/18
Pretty good stuff. Def taste the mint, which is fun. Doubt I'd want to spend $$$$, if it's really that much

Day 9. Rye day. There are a few Rye's that I love (in fact the first whisky I liked was a Rye...local distillery, not available anywhere else and expensive as hell), but most of them are not really my cup of tea. On the nose you get a lot of spices, oak, rye, and for some weird reason, basil. Interesting, haven't had that smell anywhere else so far. The initial taste is bitter, sharp, and not very enjoyable. Then you get hit by the one main note: dark bitter chocolate...hot chocolate. That one note is almost worth buying this one. It literally feels like drinking molten 99% cocoa chocolate with a drop of milk. Awesome. No sweetness whatsoever. Unfortunately, it's the only note besides bitter spices. Rather one dimensional, even if that one dimension is nice. There is no real aftertaste to speak of, just a bit of heat and spice that's staying for a couple seconds. All in all, I'm glad I tried this one because it had some interesting notes in the smell and in the taste, but it's not something I'd pour to just enjoy a glass. Also, price/performance ratio doesn't work out.
It's whisky alright.  I got some raw sweetness and spice with oak.  The aftertaste stuck with me until my next meal hours later.  It wasn't awful, but it wasn't for me.

Maple, mint and basil on the nose. Light maple and strong mint on the palate, followed by spicyness and some heat. It’s a different experience and my first rye, but for this price I doubt that I want to get it again.
Rather generic and lifeless whiskey. Young and lacking in complexity. For the price I seriously recommend this be avoided.
For the price I thought I would enjoy it straight. It is good for Manhattans or old fashions

This was the single barrel, which I did not see listed on the site. Anyway, this is an interesting one. It has a unique flavor profile compared to other ryes I've tried in the past. Honey and maple on the nose. Brown sugar and iced tea on the palate. Not a particularly memorable finish. Overall, it's decent. 3 stars, and that may be considered a bit generous. It's not objectively bad, just not for me. Still better than their bourbon, which I found to be highly disappointing. At this point, I think I'll stay away from Hudson in the future.
Butterscotch vanilla clove cinnamon. Spicy finish
unique noise. strong finish. feels light, like helium light. synthetic taste. smooth enough I would drink but not buy.
Tasted at The Feed Co. Not a fan. I just don’t like Rye.
This is the rye I had at home that ENNEAD gave me. It’s okay.
Decent. Long woody exit. No, seriously. Kinda sweet, but flat from entry to the mid pallet. I’d do it again, but wouldn’t seek it out.
very peppery and sharp. good finish
incredibly sweet and drinkable. could definitely drink this a lot
3.1   For mixing only.  Do not buy.
Sweet. Strong maple smell and taste immediately. Little bit of spice at first, moreso the longer you drink it
day 21 of Advent calendar.  Sweet but nothing to write home about
Ok. Had at 30 hop in Cedar Rapids
Tastes like licking an envelope. Very leathery.
Nope. Tasted like licking an envelope
One of the worst whiskeys I’ve ever had. Don’t you dare buy it.
Not my favorite but still and excellent whiskey, very savory, on the cusp of bitter but not quite there, smooth finish, large amounts of clove, almost as much as a clove cigar
Noses soft and buttery, but starts sharp on the palate.  Buttered corn flavors, sweet with plenty of spice.

Nose. Pine tar. Figs. Tobacco and cinnamon, tea .
Taste. Red hots, almost a wheat finish. Lingering spice. Oily mouthfeel. 
Very interesting. Apricot.
Whisky de seigle vieilli en fût neuf de chêne américain. Facile à déguster, très bon équilibre entre le bois et le seigle. Beaucoup de corps et de longueur.
Spicy, underdeveloped flavors, numbs my tongue
Great rye notes, almost hits it perfectly, but there's a distinct oak finish, which is in no way bad at all.
Mellow, nice body. On the herbal and oaky side of rye
Tried this at whiskey washback. Solid stuff with notes of cloves, pepper, marshmallows, and apples.

入口稍微辣口 尾韻長。很特別

Delicious. 
Nose- mint, baking spices & Oak
Palate- silky viscosity & rich flavors of toffee, baking spice & Barrel spice but also slight notes of pepper & clove. 
Finish- Moderate & pleasant
Complex spices upfront but not overly spicy and smooth.
Very full & smoky, just enough kick w/ spiciness.  Instant favorite.

Copper brown with thin legs. Cinnamon and oak. Pepper, mint, and dry oak.
